title: Noonan and What’s Fair and True at the Jan. 6 Hearings
sub_head: It is easy to tell a compelling story when only one side gets to present evidence.
body:
In “Trump and Biden Both Face Rejection” (Declarations, June 25), Peggy Noonan heaps praise on the Jan. 6 hearings for yielding a “coherent story” of President Trump’s culpability. That is easy to do when only one side gets to present evidence, call witnesses and disregard potentially exculpatory evidence.
A striking parallel exists between the Jan. 6 hearings and the Biden administration’s proposed Title IX rule. Both condone procedural unfairness and call it justice.
